sourcerer.base module¶

class sourcerer.base.Name(code, validate=True, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: sourcerer.base.Statement

A variable/function/class/... name

n = Name(“helloworld”) -> (unquoted) helloworld

Note

Unless the validate flag is set to False, this will reformat a name if it is not a proper python variable name n = Name(“123*helloworld”) -> (unquoted) helloworld

Parameters:validate (bool) – Should name be converted to valid python variable name?
static make_valid(name)[source]¶

Convert a string to a valid python name

Parameters:name (string) – The name to be converted
class sourcerer.base.Num(code, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: sourcerer.base.Statement

A number. Int or Float.

n = Num(“4”) -> 4

n = Num(4) -> 4

n = Num(4.0) -> 4.0

class sourcerer.base.Statement(code='', scope=None, whitespace='', line_ending='n')[source]¶

Bases: object

A line of code

A Statement is a line of code that may or may not have a child Scope

add_child(child)[source]¶

Append a child to this statements scope

Parameters:child (Statement) – The child to append
add_children(child_list)[source]¶

A convenience function to load multiple children into this scope

Parameters:child_list (list) – a list of children to append to this objects scope
build_renderer(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Overwrite this function to customize how render should be called for particular objects

create_lineage(lineage)[source]¶

Create a hierarchical lineage of children with this object as the oldest member. eg. children = [c1, [c2.1, c2.2], c3] result – self (top level)

|-> c1
|-> c2.1
c2.2 |-> c3
format()[source]¶

Abstract function to format properties this object

from_lineage(lineage)[source]¶

Create a hierarchical list of parents with this object as the youngest decentant

Lineage will be arranged in the order the parents are provided. eg. parents = [p1, p2, p3] result – p1 (top level)

|->p2
|->p3
|->self

In this example the top level parent would be at scope level n+1 and this object would be at scope level n+4.

Parameters:lineage (list) – a hierarchical list of parents for this object.
from_parent(parent)[source]¶

Append this statement to a parents scope

Parameters:parent (Statement) – The aprrent to be appended to
generate()[source]¶

Abstract function to set self.code

render(level=-1, increment=1)[source]¶

Return this statement and all children recursively

Parameters:
  • level (int) – The indentation level to set for this statement
  • increment (int) – The number of indentation levels for the child scope
static to_statement(item)[source]¶

Convert a string to a Statement

If the argument passed is already a Statement, return it unaltered If the argument passed is a Non-string or statement, return an empty Statement

Parameters:item (str, Statement) – The object to be converted to a Statement
class sourcerer.base.Str(code, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: sourcerer.base.Statement

A quoted string

s = Str(“hello world”) -> literal ‘hello world’

static string_args(args)[source]¶

Enclose your positional arguments in strings so it can be used as an argument, rather than part of the arg spec.

Parameters:args (list/string) – A string/list of strings to be quoted
